data.title: Historical Figures Born on September 29
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in history for the 29th of September. See which explorers, inventors and historical figures were born on September 29.
data.text:
Pompey the Great

Roman political and military leader (1st Triumvirate and Consul), born in Picenum, Italy

Margaret of England, Queen consort of Scotland, (d. 1275)

John of Artois, Count of Eu, French soldier (d. 1387)

Joan of Kent [the Fair Maid of Kent], famous English beauty, wife of Edward the Black Prince, mother of Richard II, born at Palace of Woodstock, England (d. 1385)

Thomas of Lancaster, 1st Duke of Clarence, son of Henry IV of England (d. 1421)

Ferdinand, the Holy Prince, Portuguese prince, and prisoner of war at Fez, The Marinid Sultanate (d. 1443)

Michael Servetus, Spanish theologian and physician (Christianism Rostituta), born in Villanueva or Tudela, Spain (d. 1553)

Tintoretto, Italian Mannerist painter and notable exponent of the Renaissance school, born in Venice, Republic of Venice (d. 1594)

Miguel de Cervantes

Spanish author (Don Quixote), born in Alcalá de Henares, Habsburg Spain

William V, Duke of Bavaria (d. 1626)

Adriaan van Roomen, Flemish mathematician, born in Leuven (d. 1615)

Caravaggio [Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio], Italian painter (Saint Francis of Assisi in Ecstasy) [birthdate disputed], born in Milan (d. 1610)

John VIII, the Younger, Count of Nassau-Siegen and field marshal, born in Dillenburg (d. 1638)

Jean Louis d'Elderen, 63rd prince-bishop of Luik (1688-94), born in Tongeren (modern Belgium) (d. 1694)

Thomas Tenison, English Archbishop of Canterbury (1694-1715), born in Cottenham, England (d. 1715)

Lord William Russell, English politician and plotter against Charles II (d. 1683)

Antoine Coyzevox, French Baroque sculptor (Palace of Versailles), born in Lyon, France (d. 1720) baptism date

Adrien-Maurice, 3rd duc de Noailles, French soldier during reign of Louis XIV (d. 1766)

Richard Challoner, English leading Catholic bishop (Douay–Rheims bible translation), born in Lewes, England (d. 1781)

François Boucher, French Rococo painter commissioned by Madame de Pompadour, born in Paris, France (d. 1770)

Peter Albertus van de Parra, Dutch Governor-general of Dutch East-Indies (1761-75), born in Colombo, Dutch Ceylon (d. 1775)

Nikita Ivanovich Panin, Russian statesman and advisor to Catherine the Great (plot against Peter III), born in Danzig (d. 1783)

Robert Clive, English explorer and founder (British Empire in India), born in Styche, England (d. 1773)

Horatio Nelson

British admiral and hero of Trafalgar, born in Burnham Thorpe, Norfolk

William Beckford, British writer (Vathek), politician, plantation owner, and art collector, born in Soho Square, London (d. 1844) [some sources give birth date as Oct 1]

Guadalupe Victoria

Mexican independence leader, general and 1st President of Mexico (1824-29), born in Tamazula, New Spain

Charles-Francois Sturm, French mathematician (Sturm's Theorem), born in Geneva, Switzerland (d. 1855)

1803 Mercator Cooper, American sea captain (first to visit Japan and Antarctica), born in Southampton, New York (d. 1872)

Elizabeth Gaskell, English novelist (North and South), born in London, England (d. 1865)

Adolph Göpel, German mathematician (hyperelliptic functions), born in Rostock (d. 1847)

Andreas Aschenbach, German Romantic painter and engraver, born in Kassel (d. 1910)

Bradley Tyler Johnson, Brigadier General (Confederate Army), (d. 1903)

1829 Giles Alexander Smith, American Major General (Union Army), born in Jefferson County, New York (d. 1876)

John Parker Hawkins, American Brevet Major General (Union Army), born in Indianapolis, Indiana (d. 1914)

John McAlister Schofield, American Major General (Union Army), born in Gerry, New York (d. 1906)

Henry Hobson Richardson, American Romanesque revival architect (Thomas Crane Public Library), born in St James, Louisiana (d. 1886)

Louis J. Weichmann, American clerk who was the chief witness in the trial of the assassination of Abraham Lincoln, born in Baltimore, Maryland (d. 1902)

Mikhail Skobelev 'the White General', Russian general during Russo-Turkish War, born in Saint Petersburg, Russia (d. 1882)

Caroline Yale, American educator who revolutionized the teaching of hearing-impaired students, born in Charlotte, Vermont (d. 1943)

Princess Thyra, daughter of Christian IX of Denmark (d. 1933)

Conrad Theodor van Deventer, Dutch author, lawyer and politician (Ethical Policy Movement), born in Dordrecht, Netherlands (d. 1915)

Franz Zorell, German lexicographer and exegete (Hebrew Latin Dictionary), born in Ravensburg (d. 1947)

1863 Hugo Haase, German socialist politician (SPD, USPD) and co-chair of the Council of the People's Deputies (1918-19), born in Allenstein, East Prussia (d. 1919)

Miguel de Unamuno, Spanish writer and philosopher (Ensayos, Teatro), born in Bilbao Spain (d. 1936)

Mykhailo Hrushevsky, Ukrainian historian and statesman, born in Chełm, Congress Poland (d. 1934)

Ludwig von Mises, Austrian-American Economist (The Anti-Capitalistic Mentality), born in Lemberg, Austria-Hungary (d. 1973)

Joseph Banks Rhine, American parapsychologist (Extra-Sensory Perception), born in Waterloo, Pennsylvania (d. 1980)

1895 Roscoe Turner, American aviator and racer (d. 1970)

Herbert Agar, American journalist and historian (d. 1980)

Trofim Lysenko, Soviet biologist and agronomist, born in Karlovka, Ukraine, Russian Empire (d. 1976)

Billy Butlin, South African-British holiday camp promoter (Butlins), born in Cape Town, Cape Colony (d. 1980)

1899 Lásló Jósef Bíró, Hungarian inventor (ballpoint pen), born in Budapest, Hungary (d. 1985)

Miguel Alemán Valdés, Mexican attorney and President of Mexico (1946-52), born in Sayula, Veracruz, Mexico (d. 1983)

Enrico Fermi

Italian-American nuclear physicist, gone fission, fermium (Nobel Prize 1938), born in Rome, Italy

Lanza del Vasto, Italian philosopher and activist (d. 1981)

Diana Vreeland, French-American fashion editor (Harper's Bazaar; Vogue), born in Paris (d. 1989)

Dorothy Emmet, English philosopher, born in London, England (d. 2000)

Norman Anderson, English lawyer, missionary and Arabist, born in Aldeburgh, England (d. 1994)

Reginald Victor Jones, British scientist who worked in military intelligence in WWII, born in London, England (d. 1997)

Michelangelo Antonioni, Italian director (Blowup, Red Desert), born in Ferrara, Italy (d. 2007)

Vincent DeDomenico, American entrepreneur (Rice-A-Roni), born in San Francisco, California (d. 2007)

Carl Ronald Giles, English cartoonist (Giles), born in London, England (d. 1995)

Peter D. Mitchell, English chemist, (1978 Nobel Prize for Chemistry), born in Mitcham, England (d. 1992)

Miklós Jancsó, Hungarian director (Muzsika, Aube, Pacifist), born in Vac, Hungry (d. 2014)

Stan Berenstain, American children's author (The Berenstain Bears), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 2005)

David Atkinson, British air marshal, honorary physician to the Queen (d. 2013)

John Tower, American politician (Senate-R-Tx 1961-85), born in Houston, Texas (d. 1991)

Pete McCloskey, American politician (US Representative from California, 1967-83), born in Loma Linda, California (d. 2024)

Ankie Peypers, Dutch author and poet (d. 2008)

1928 Eric Lubbock, Lord Avebury, English politician and human rights advocate (Liberal MP for Orpington 1962-70), born in Orpington, England (d. 2016)

Colin Dexter, English crime writer (Inspector Morse), born in Stamford, Lincolnshire (d. 2017)

1930 Peter Miller, British Chairman of Lloyd's Bank of London (d. 2018)

James Cronin, American nuclear physicist (Physics Nobel Prize 1980), born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 2016)

1931 Joseph M. McDade, American politician (Rep-R-Pennsylvania, 1963-1999), born in Scranton, Pennsylvania (d. 2017)

Peter Stormonth Darling, Scottish investment banker (Mercury Asset Management Group, largest fundmanagement the UK), (d. 2019)

1932 Rainer Weiss, American Physicist (Nobel Prize 2017, LIGO), born in Berlin, Germany

1932 Ronald B. Kitaj, American-British painter and graphic artist (pop art), born in Chagrin Falls, Ohio (d. 2007)

Samora Machel, President of Mozambique (1975-86), born in Gaza Province, Mozambique (d. 1986)

Mihály Csíkszentmihályi, Hungarian- American psychologist (concept of "flow"), born in Rijeka, Kingdom of Italy (d. 2021)

David Hannay, British diplomat (UK representative to the UN and EU), born in London, England

Silvio Berlusconi

Italian media tycoon and politician (Prime Minister of Italy, 1994-95, 2001-06, 2008-11), born in Milan, Italy [1]

Barry Heywood, British director of the British Antarctic Survey (d. 2021)

Henry Keswick, British businessman (CEO Jardine Matheson), born in Shanghai

1938 Wim Kok, Dutch politician, Dutch Prime Minister (1994-2002), born in Bergambacht, Netherlands (d. 2018)

Jimmy Knapp, British trade unionist (National Union of Railwaymen) (d. 2001)

Frederick "Fred" West, British contractor and serial killer (12 charges of murder), born in Herefordshire, England (d. 1995)

1941 Jon Brower Minnoch, American, world's heaviest recorded man at 1,400lb (635 kilograms; 100 stone), born in Bainbridge Island, Washington recorded man (d. 1983)

Bill Nelson, American astronaut (STS 61C), attorney,and politician (U.S. Representative (D) Florida, 1979-1999; U.S. Senate (D) Florida, 2001-19; NASA Administrator, 2021- ), born in Miami, Florida

Gary Boyd Roberts, American genealogist

Lech Wałęsa

Polish Solidarity movement leader (Nobel Peace Prize 1983) and President of Poland (1990-95), born in Popowo, Poland

1943 Mohammad Khatami, Iranian politician, President of Iran (1997-2005), born in Ardakan, Iran

1943 Peter Rigby, British businessman and one of UK richest (Specialist Computer Holdings)

Sarah Tyacke, English historian and Keeper of British Public Records, born in Chelmsford, Essex

Alasdair Fraser, Scottish-born Northern Irish lawyer, director of Public Prosecutions for Northern Ireland, born in Glasgow, Scotland (d. 2012)

Richard J. Evans, English historian (The Third Reich Trilogy), born in London, England

John M. McHugh, American politician (Rep-R-NY 1993-2009) Secretary of the Army 2009-15, born in Watertown, New York

Andrés Caicedo, Colombian writer (¡Que viva la música!), born in Cali, Colombia (d. 1977)

Michelle Bachelet

Chilean Socialist Party politician (President of Chile, 2006-10 &, 2014-18; U.N. High Commissioner for Human Rights, 2018-22), born in Santiago, Chile

Max Sandlin, American politician (Rep-D-Texas 1997-2005), born in Texarkana, Arkansas

Masoud Pezeshkian, Iranian cardiac surgeon and politician, President of Iran (2024-), born in Mahabad, Iran

1954 Steve Platt, British journalist and magazine editor (New Statesman & Society)

Gwen Ifill, American journalist and writer, 1st African American woman to host US public affairs program, born in New York City (d. 2016)

James Donald Halsell Jr, American retired USAF officer and astronaut (STS 65, 74, 83, 94), born in West Monroe, Louisiana

Jon Fosse, Norwegian author (2023 Nobel Prize for Literature), born in Haugesund, Norway [1]

Julia Gillard, Australian politician, 1st Australian female Prime Minister (2010-2013), born in Barry, Wales

Siarhei Rutenka, Belarusian handball player, born in Minsk, Soviet Union

Juan Valentín Urdangarín y de Borbón, Spanish royal, son of Infanta Cristina de Borbon, born in Barcelona, Spain

Emma Tallulah Behn, Norwegian royal family member, daughter of Princess Marta Luisa
